result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Trial Order, Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on October 26th, 2022.
State's Witness List.

Jury status hearing on November 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:05 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Jeffrey A Stoper in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Jeffrey A Stoper.  Prosecuting attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes the matter was set before this court to address the Speedy Trial demand made on 10/3/22.  Atty. Wolff is asking the court to schedule the matter for trial based on the Speedy Trial Demand.  Court will set the matter for jury status and trial.  Court will prepare and sign a pretrial order.
Jury status hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on October 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

9:37 AM; Case called for Bail/bond hearing. Defendant Jeffrey A Stoper in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Jeffrey A Stoper.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes the matter is set to address Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail.  Atty. Wolff presents statements; he is asking that bail be modified to a signature bond.  State presents statements; they object to any bail modification.  Atty. Wolff presents additional statements.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will deny the motion to modify bail; bail to remain as previously set.  Court inquires if the matter has been set for trial based on the speedy trial demand.  Parties advise there is nothing scheduled yet.  Atty. Wolff advises after a brief discussion with his client he is asking the Court to withdraw the Speedy Trial Demand and set the matter for status in about 2 weeks.  Court advises it can set the matter for status in 2 weeks but that will not be before Branch 2.  Both Defense and the State have no objection to this Branch hearing the status in 2 weeks.  Court will adjourn for status hearing before this Branch in 2 weeks to formally address whether or not defense is withdrawing the Speedy trial demand and further scheduling.
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Motion for Bail Modification, filed by Attorney Wolff.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

11:49 AM Defendant Jeffrey A Stoper in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Jeffrey A Stoper.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed. 
Defense enters a demand for speedy trial.
Attorney Wolff further states he will be filing a bail motion.
Court sets a date before branch 7 next week to address the motion to modify bail and to set a trial date noting this case is assigned to Branch 2, Judge Jennifer Dorow.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Waukesha Circuit Waukesha County Clerk of Courts

Prior: 515 W Moreland Blvd, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States
Preliminary hearing on October 3, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Status conference on September 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Jeffrey A Stoper
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 09-23-2022)
Prior: 217 S Grandview Blvd, Waukesha, WI 53188

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 4 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing. Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release. Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.  If defendant has a passport, Defendant to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 24 hours of release from custody.  Defendant is not permitted to apply for the issuance,  duplicate nor renewal of a passport and/or passport card during the pendency of this action.

2:44 PM Defendant Jeffrey A Stoper in court, in custody.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Jeffrey A Stoper. Prosecuting attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Preliminary Hearing requested.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  If defendant has a passport, Defendant to surrender their passport but defendant states he does not have a passport.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
